condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).

description.narrative: 1. Number of Districts linked in to national cold chain facilities 2. Number of new cold chain facilities established (disaggregated by geographical location) 3. Product exported from target districts to international markets (Metric Tons) 4. Existence of Report on documented Markets for best markets for all crops per province with market prices and market windows (Yes/No) 5. Number of Businesses using the documented markets (# of businesses) 6. Number of MAIL employees trained on the established/updated Farm to market guidelines (Male/Female) 7. Existence of Trade Corridors Report with documented trade corridors to reach target markets (Yes/No) 8. Number of cold-chain facilities established in target provinces (#) 9. Number of businesses who received incentives from project to establish cold chain infrastructures in USD (Number of business and USD) 10. Number of traders/processors/Freight logistics companies trained on cold chain facility management (Male/Female) 11. Number of businesses who attended the trade events (#) 12. Number of businesses linked to new markets (#) 13. Amount of confirmed and potential deals made in trade events (USD of confirmed and USD of potential deals)

1. Nothing to report this quarter. In 2020, the assessment survey was conducted in Nangarhar, Badghis and Farah. Four cold storage facilities were identified in Nangarhar. There are no cold storage facilities in Farah and Badghis provinces so traders could not be linked. Activity continues. 2. In Q1-2021, CBARD-AIM has four grant awards approved for construction but none have yet been installed.(Equipment installation should begin in Q-2) For three provinces, this will result in processing 4,268 MT/year of fresh fruits and vegetables; increase cold store capacity by 5,872 MT and add 86 full time jobs & 830 indirect jobs. 3. In Q1-2021, CBARD-AIM facilitated exports totaling for CBARD-West of 240 MTs of sesame, watermelon, cumin and pistachio valued at $407,168 to primary markets in Iraq, Syria, and Turkey. 4. In Q1-2021, nothing was reported because this was already completed in 2020. 5. During Q1-2021, CBARD-AIM conducted a market assessment survey and signed 28 MOUs businesses. These businesses are using project documented markets. The MOU’s allow the businesses to access the CBARD-AIM incentive program which helps reduce trader risk when accessing new export markets. 6. CBARD AIM technical team trained five CBARD-MAIL extension staff on orchard establishment and application of chemical fertilizer, use of animal manure, mulching and irrigation. . 7.Nothing to report for Q1-2021. Target Achieved in 2020. 8. In 1Q-2021 CBARD AIM has four grants awards approved for construction but none have yet been installed. All equipment must first be assessed and approved by a Project engineer. Construction and installation should occur in Q2. For three provinces, this will result in processing 4,268 MT/year of fresh fruits and vegetables; increase cold store capacity by 5,872 MT and add 86 full time jobs & 830 indirect jobs. 9. In Q1-2021, CBARD-AIM has four grant awards approved for construction but none have yet been installed. All equipment must first be assessed and approved by a Project engineer. Construction and installation should occur in Q2. For three provinces, this will result in processing 4,268 MT/year of fresh fruits and vegetables; increase cold store capacity by 5,872 MT and add 86 full time jobs & 830 indirect jobs. 10.. In 1Q-2021 CBARD-AIM selected four applications for grant awards as mentioned above. The grants Team has been working closely with the four agribusinesses to finalize the awards, including technical specifications of equipment. Three of the four haven been finalized. The fourth should be completed by mid-April. A TOR for an engineer has been advertised on the ROP Website who will assist with technical training for management, operation, and maintenance of cold chain equipment and processing center.business at the 2021 Gulfood Exhibition held in Dubai from February 21-25, 2021. 11. In 1Q 2021 CBARD-AIM sponsored two new exhibitors and four Afghan traders as observers, including a woman- owned business at the 2021 Gulfood Exhibition held in Dubai from February 21-25, 2021. 12. In Q1-2021 CBARD-AIM 1 business exported 25 MTs of watermelon seed at a value of $31,909 to Damishq city of of Syria, which is a new market. 13. In Q1-2021 $ 2.52 million in confirmed deals were signed at Gulfood. Exhibitors signed 25 confirmed deals totaling 1,050MT, generating a value of $2.51 million. Two exhibitors and 5 observers (5 men and 1 woman) participated at Gulfood.
